ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please rate the CURRENT (i.e. LAST 2 WEEKS) SEVERITY of your insomnia problem(s).Difficulty falling asleep PX640801_Insomnia_Falling_Asleep
Notes: 0=None; 1=Mild; 2=Moderate; 3=Severe; 4=Very Severe; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: Please rate the CURRENT (i.e. LAST 2 WEEKS) SEVERITY of your insomnia problem(s).Difficulty staying asleep PX640801_Insomnia_Staying_Asleep
Notes: 0=None; 1=Mild; 2=Moderate; 3=Severe; 4=Very Severe; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: Please rate the CURRENT (i.e. LAST 2 WEEKS) SEVERITY of your insomnia problem(s).Problems waking up too early PX640801_Insomnia_Waking_Up_Early
Notes: 0=None; 1=Mild; 2=Moderate; 3=Severe; 4=Very Severe; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: How SATISFIED/DISSATISFIED are you with your CURRENT sleep pattern? PX640801_Insomnia_SatisfiedDissatisfied_Sleep_Pattern
Notes: 0=Very Satisfied; 1=Satisfied; 2=Moderately Satisfied; 3=Dissatisfied; 4=Very Dissatisfied; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: How NOTICEABLE to others do you think your sleep problem is in terms of impairing the quality of your life? PX640801_Insomnia_Noticeable_Impairing_QOL
Notes: 0=Not at all Noticeable; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Much; 4=Very much Noticeable; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: How WORRIED/DISTRESSED are you about your current sleep problem? PX640801_Insomnia_Worried_Distressed
Notes: 0=Not at all Worried; 2=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Much; 4=Very much Worried; 9999=no data

ElementDescription: To what extent do you consider your sleep problem to INTERFERE with your daily functioning (e.g. daytime fatigue, mood, ability to function at work/daily chores, concentration, memory, mood, etc.) CURRENTLY? PX640801_Insomnia_Interfere_DailyFunctioning
Notes: 0=Not at all Interfering; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Much; 4=Very much Interfering; 9999= no data

ElementDescription: Insomnia Total score   PX640801_Insomnia_Scoring
Notes: Total score categories:  0-7 = No clinically significant insomnia;  8-14 = Sub-threshold insomnia;  15-21 = Clinical insomnia (moderate severity);  22-28 = Clinical insomnia (severe)

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: Time Point
Notes: 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing
